author: Reuters Editorial
title: Merkel wants constructive talks with Italy
text:
LISBON (Reuters) - Germany will try to work constructively with a new government in Italy, Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Thursday, adding it was important for Europe to show it can work effectively as a bloc.
German Chancellor Angela Merkel looks smiles during a news conference with Portugal's Prime Minister Antonio Costa in Lisbon, Portugal, May 31 2018. REUTERS/Rafael Marchante “In Italy we’re waiting for the government to form, I want to reach out to the new government in an open-minded way,” Merkel said at a news conference with the Portuguese prime minister, adding she would do everything possible to work well together.
“In a situation like we have now it’s very, very important that Europe does everything it can to be capable of acting at any point and that’s why this (EU) budget has become an important psychological signal,” she said.
Reporting by Axel Bugge; Writing by Madeline Chambers in Berlin; Editing by Michelle Martin
